meanings.meaning_en_US: To retreat from a position or situation.

examples.sentence: He had to [draw back] when the situation got too tense.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當情況變得太緊張時，他不得不撤回來。

examples.sentence: She [drew back] from making a decision quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她撤回了快速做出決定的動作。

examples.sentence: I had to [draw back] from the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不得不退出這場爭論。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To use information or a resource to support an idea or action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使用資訊或資源來支持一個想法或行動

examples.sentence: You should [draw on] your past experiences when making a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在做決定時應該利用你的過去經歷。

examples.sentence: The professor [drew on] his extensive research for the lecture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 教授在講課中引用了他的廣泛研究。

examples.sentence: She tends to [draw on] various sources for her work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她傾向於為她的工作引用不同的資源。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attract someone's notice.

examples.sentence: The presentation [drew my attention] with its vibrant visuals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個演示用其生動的視覺效果吸引了我的注意。

examples.sentence: She always tries to [draw people's attention] with her outfit.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是試圖用她的穿著吸引人們的注意。

examples.sentence: The artwork [drew our eye] immediately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這幅藝術作品立即吸引了我們的目光。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To elicit a response or encourage someone to express themselves.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 引出反應或鼓勵某人表達自己

examples.sentence: The therapist was able to [draw out] her feelings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 治療師能夠引出她的感受。

examples.sentence: He gently [drew out] the child's thoughts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他輕柔地引導孩子的想法。

examples.sentence: The interview aimed to [draw out] useful information.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這次面試旨在引出有用的信息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To come to a stop gradually.

examples.sentence: The car [drew to a halt] at the traffic light.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 汽車在紅綠燈前逐漸停下來。

examples.sentence: The conversation [drew to a stop] after the topic changed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當話題改變後，談話逐漸停止。

examples.sentence: As the train [drew to a halt], passengers prepared to disembark.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當火車逐漸停下時，乘客準備下車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To prepare a document or plan.

examples.sentence: The attorney will [draw up] the contract tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 律師明天將準備合同。

examples.sentence: They [drew up] a list of recommendations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們擬定了一份建議清單。

examples.sentence: We need to [draw up] a budget for the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要為活動準備預算。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gradually decrease in quantity or quality.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 逐漸減少在數量或質量上

examples.sentence: The crowd started to [drop away] as the event ended.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著活動結束，人群開始減少。

examples.sentence: Interest in the project began to [drop away].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對這個項目的興趣開始減少。

examples.sentence: Support for the campaign has [dropped away] over time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著時間的推移，對該運動的支持減少了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lag behind in performance or progress.

examples.sentence: He [dropped behind] the rest of the team during the race.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在比賽中，他落後於其他隊員。

examples.sentence: The project has [dropped behind] schedule due to delays.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於延遲，該項目已經落後於時間表。

examples.sentence: If he doesn't improve, he will [drop behind] his classmates.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果他不進步，他將落後於同班同學。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a brief visit to someone without a prior appointment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在未事先約定的情況下向某人進行簡短訪問

examples.sentence: I decided to [drop in on] my friend while I was in town.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在城裡的時候決定去看望我的朋友。

examples.sentence: She often [drops in on] her grandparents on weekends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常在周末探望她的祖父母。

examples.sentence: Don't forget to [drop in on] the new neighbors!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別忘了去看望新鄰居！

meanings.meaning_en_US: To send someone a brief message or letter.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 給某人發送簡短的消息或信件

examples.sentence: Just [drop me a line] when you arrive.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你到達時給我發個簡訊。

examples.sentence: She promised to [drop him a line] whenever she can.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她答應每當她可以的時候都會給他發個簡訊。

examples.sentence: You can always [drop a line] to let me know how you're doing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你隨時可以發個簡訊讓我知道你的情況。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Because of; as a result of.

examples.sentence: The game was postponed [due to] rain.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 比賽因為下雨而推遲。

examples.sentence: Flights are delayed [due to] technical issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 航班因技術問題而延遲。

examples.sentence: The store closed early [due to] a power outage.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於停電，商店提前關閉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To participate in an activity or event.

examples.sentence: He loves to [engage in] sports during his free time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡在空閒時間參加體育活動。

examples.sentence: They [engaged in] a heated debate about the topic.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們就這個話題進行了激烈的辯論。

examples.sentence: We encourage students to [engage in] community service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們鼓勵學生參加社區服務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: From that time onwards; continuously since that time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從那時起；自那時以來持續不變

examples.sentence: I have lived here [ever since] I was a child.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從我還是個孩子時我就住在這裡。

examples.sentence: She started painting [ever since] her trip to France.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從她去法國旅行以來，她就開始畫畫。

examples.sentence: They have been friends [ever since] they met in college.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從他們在大學相遇以來，他們一直是朋友。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not including; apart from.

examples.sentence: Everyone attended the meeting [except for] John.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 除了約翰，所有人都參加了會議。

examples.sentence: I like all fruits [except for] bananas.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡所有水果，除了香蕉。

examples.sentence: The store is open every day [except for] holidays.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家商店在每一天都開放，除了假期。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin to sleep.

examples.sentence: I often [fall asleep] while watching TV.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我經常在看電視時入睡。

examples.sentence: He [fell asleep] during the lecture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在講座中入睡了。

examples.sentence: It's easy to [fall asleep] in a warm room.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在溫暖的房間裡入睡是很容易的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gradually diminish or decrease.

examples.sentence: His interest in the project began to [fall away].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對這個項目的興趣開始減少。

examples.sentence: Support for the movement has [fallen away] in recent months.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對該運動的支持在最近幾個月下降了。

examples.sentence: As people get older, some friendships may [fall away].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著人們年齡的增長，某些友誼可能會減少。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become less liked or appreciated.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得不再受歡迎或被欣賞

examples.sentence: He has [fallen from favor] due to recent controversies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於最近的爭議，他已經不再受歡迎。

examples.sentence: Many artists [fall from favor] over time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著時間的推移，許多藝術家失去了受歡迎的地位。

examples.sentence: Politicians often [fall from favor] after scandals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 政治家在醜聞後往往不再受歡迎。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To develop a strong affection for someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人產生強烈的愛慕之情

examples.sentence: They [fell in love] during college.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在大學期間相愛。

examples.sentence: It's easy to [fall in love] with a kind person.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與一個善良的人相愛是容易的。

examples.sentence: He [fell in love] at first sight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他一見鍾情。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start doing something regularly.

examples.sentence: He has [fallen into the habit of] exercising every morning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他養成了每天早上鍛煉的習慣。

examples.sentence: They [fall into the habit of] meeting weekly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們形成了每週見面的習慣。

examples.sentence: She has [fallen into the habit of] reading before bedtime.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她已經養成了臨睡前閱讀的習慣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To associate or connect with a group or idea.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與一個團體或想法建立聯繫或關係

examples.sentence: She decided to [fall in with] a new group of friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定與新朋友群建立關係。

examples.sentence: He tends to [fall in with] the wrong crowd.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他傾向於與不良群體為伍。

examples.sentence: They easily [fell in with] a team of like-minded individuals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們輕鬆地與志同道合的人組成團隊。
